text:
At the very beginning, I honnestly was not expecting to study educational sciences and just wanted to study politics, especially in SciencesPo Reims because there is a specialization on American politics and these are my favorite topic. I even wanted to go study to the University of Idaho (in Paris, Paris) this year but let's  just say that it was a little too complicated.
     In 2021 and in 2022, a lot of things happened that afflicted my personnal motivation and I ended up wondering if I was really made for politics and the answer was: yes but, I do not want to work into it at the beginning of my professional life. So I asked myself whether or not I was attracted by a social career. And here I am, today, ready to study educational sciences for the five next years in order to work as a "main education adviser" (I honnestly do not know the word for "CPE" in english).
     There are a lot of things that I find interesting in this job. First of all, when you are a "CPE" you kind of are the link between the five main components of a high school: teachers, pupils, pupils' parents, the administration and the educational team (I mean the "vie scolaire" but once again, I do not know the specific name in english). Therefore, you have to adopt a multitask view of the different issues. Then, I have to admit that being employed directly by the French state has a lot of pros (honnestly not the wage, but I am being fully honnest when saying that for me it is not an issue) and I think that it is important to keep it in mind. Another very important thing for me, is to have enough free time to be present for my family but also, to keep working on different projects (yes, I still want to do politics at the end of my career). And finally, as a person who had a lot of mental health issues when he was a pupil, I find it inspiring to know that maybe one day, someone will come at my desk to speak about his own issues and that I will be able, thanks to my own experience, to tell him that even if it is complicated to see things this way, everything is gonna be okay one day or another and that life is made out of good and bad moments and we have to accept it.
